text: Butelka. Pusto w aromacie, nieco karmelu i klepki. W smaku trochę dębiny, nieco torfowe (?!).

(542 nap) Hatalmas, szivacsos, sokáig kitartó barna hab, egészen sötétbarna szín. Csokis, kakaós, aszalt gyümölcsös illatok. Fekete csokis, kakaóporos, kávés ízvilág, enyhe aszaltszilvás aromával és markáns fűszeres vonással. Nehézsúlyú versenyző, enyhe szénsavtartalommal és erős keserűvel. Finom, de nekem túl erős a pörkölésből eredő keserűje.

Pours a dark body with a beige head. Aroma of syrup and plums. Malty taste with tones of bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Najpierw zacznę od wad. Metalicznosc wyraźna, dosyć wkurzająca. Alkohol dosyć wyczuwalny ale nie spirytusowy. Teraz plusy. Wali w czerep! W taki pozytywny sposób. Ostre, karmelowe, słodowe. Rozgrzewa. Sporo dojrzałych owoców.Charakterne. Ciekawe piwo, albo polubisz albo odrzuci.

Svart, mörkbeiget skum.
Doft: torkad frukt, fikon, fruktigt syrlig, kaffe, lite ekfat, aningen metall.
Smak: lite rökig, fat, söt, fikon, vanilj, besk och rökig i eftersmaken.

Flaska från Beergium, åtminstone två år gammal. Provning med ölsällskapet. Svart med liten brun ton och ett brunbeiget, gräddigt skum. Doft av chark, lätt rökigt, rostad malt och råg, toffee. Gräddig och len kropp, medium till stor. Matt smak av choklad, kakao, lite kaffebeska, bränt socker, mörk kola, malt. Trevlig beska och lite brända toner i avslutningen. Viss sötma i ölen, men ganska tillbakahållen. Lång eftersmak. Gott! Drar något mer åt en stout än strong ale.
Bottle (1 pint 6oz) at home. Spectacular beer, intensive aroma, dark colour, including the head, and great coffe flavour

Zwarte kleur met bruine schuimkraag met grote vlokken. Geur: geroosterde mout, metaal, koffie, drop. Smaak: hoppig, licht zoet, alcoholisch, ietwat fruitig. Romig mondgevoel. Afdronk: geroosterde mout, wat sinaasappel, alcoholisch. Lekker en complex.

W aromacie rodzynki i wiśnia w likierze. W smaku natomiast trochę inny świat. Kawa, lekko cierpkie, dosyć surowe. Bardzo lekko się je pije, alkohol jest świetnie ukryty. Absolutnie bezkompromisowe "chamskie" piwo. Podeszło mi.
Zwart bier met een goede bruine schuim kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, hout, rood fruit, kruidig, koffie. Smaakt geroosterd, koffie, chocolade, kruidig.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt vol koffie, vanille, mout, gebrande. Smaakt vol koffie gebrande, houtig.
Mooi zwart, ruikt erg zwaar. Houtig. Smaakt ook zo. Lekker, beetje veel gebrand.

Poured into a snifter, the appearance was a pure dark black color with a nice looking fingers worth of off white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Adequate messy lace.
The aroma had some roasty coffee beans up front with a slight milk chocolate, and then dark chocolate, quite robust. Vanilla and some woody sweetness round it out.
The flavor pulls a drying sweetness from the blend of the wood to the coffee beans and malts to play with a rugged semi-sweet and bitter aftertaste. Leads with a semi-sticky sort of roasty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fair sipping quality about it. Good carbonation. ABV felt right as where the brewer said it does.
Overall, says its an American strong ale on here, I thought this was an American Imperial Stout. Thats what I rated it as and believe it to be. Wonderful as an American Imperial Stout, nowhere close to an American Strong ale.

From the cellar, i think i bought this from Carl @Nectar West End, Its black, thick and the light brown head falls to 5mm cap, clings to side of the glass. Aromas of Oak, whiskey, caramel, chocolate, dark berries and licorice. tastes of bitter dark chocolate, woody oak, Whiskey and licorice. Sweet and oily though has a long roasty bitter finish. Numbing sensational ale.
Black liquid with brownish head. Aroma of herbs, alcohol, chocolate. Tastes same, medium+ sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, average carb, long fin.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with medium brown-fluffy sticky head,stays. Aroma: hay, chocolate, coffee, herbs, weak mint. Taste: medium bitter, coffee, chocolate, weak smoke, dry. Full body. Long roasted bitter finish. Nice.Well balanced.

Wathing snooker the masters 2017. what a beer. pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, dark fruits, and caramel. Extremely rich and complex palate, with dark dark chocolate, dark fruits, a little bourbon, vanilla and oak. Absolutely wonderful treat.
Pitch black oil...some dark roast aroma. No carbonation no head, but thats is ok, had a nice roast flavor some sherry and alcohol heat.

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, big brown head. Nose is roasted, cocoa, light soy sauce. Taste is medium bitterness, light coca, roasted malts , coffee. Aftertaste is lingering bitterness, with coffee notes. Full mouthfeel, decent alcoholic warmth. Very nice beer overall.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: Black with a medium mocha head. NOSE: strong aroma of roasted malt, wood, coffee, mocha, caramel. TASTE: lightly sweet, high bitterness. PALATE: full body.

Sampled at Degustacje Piwa w Szczecinie group meeting. Aroma: Lot of chocolate, roastiness, coffee, biscuits, vanilla, dark malts. Appearance: Nearly totally black colour, nice head. Taste: Bitter dark beer, roasty, high biterness, chocolate, coffee, light fruit, biscuits. Palate: Semi-dry finish, full body, low carbonation.
Bottle shared by Jessica H thanks. Big and semi lasting brown head. Liqurish aroma and milk chocolate aroma. Hoppy and bitter sweet chocolate taste.

Bomber produced 10 months ago pours black with a thick brown head that takes a while and leaves thick lacing. Aroma is of coffee, malt, wood. Flavor is coffee, wood, unsweetened chocolate. Plenty of bitterness, a bit under sweetened for the style. Leaves a nice bitter chocolate aftertaste.

Have drank a few of these over the years. It pours an extremely dark and thick black ale with a med to thick fluffy tan head that lingers. A complex aroma that delivers intense roastiness, chocolate, coffee, barrel and earth. A whole array of flavors in a mouthful - roasted grain, burnt toast, bitter chocolate, espresso and a long bitter aftertaste. Yum

Svart och nästan stilla. Kallt kaffe och rätt fin Stout. Lite kärv på slutet, trevligt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A black body with hardly any head, almost no lace left on my glass. Aroma of alcohol, malts, a little fruit, and chocolate. Flavors were similar to the taste, alcohol is hidden fairly well. I was kinda surprised to see this listed as a strong ale it walks and talks like a stout, overall it was a pretty decent brew. Originally rated on 10/24/08.

Pours a near black brown from a bottle, thick khaki head with a small bit of lacing. Aroma of oak and raisins. Flavor is balsamic vinegar and cherry and bark. It all just seems a little too much. Oh, and its quite bitter.

Piwo ładnie prezentuje się w szkle, bujna brązowa piana oblepia ścianki, barwa ciemno mahoniowa, wydaje się opalizująca. W zapachu uderza intensywne toffi, krówka i karmel, za którymi łeb w łeb podąża chmiel w postaci ziół, świerku i żywicy. Smak półwytrawny, nie do końca gra z dość słodkim aromatem. Tu z kolei dominuje karmel, przypalany karmel, cukierki irysy (niesłodzone?), żywica, w posmakach sos sojowy, czarna czekolada i popiół... Goryczka średnia do wysokiej, długa, ziołowo tytoniowa. Wysycenie niskie, pełne i oleiste w odbiorze, alkohol ładnie ukryty, rozgrzewa po przełknięciu.
Dość ciekawe piwo, fajny aromat i faktura, w smaku brakuje mi więcej słodyczy, jakiegoś wyraźniejszego współgrania z zapachem...

Got a bomber of this at City Beer in San Francisco for maybe $8 or $9. Dark black color with thin light brown head and little lacing. Aroma is vinous, with strong grape and berries. Flavor has roasted malts, rich woodiness, and berries. Finishes dry with strong woodiness. Very very good.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, coffee, and some dark fruits.

650 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with full head. Aromas of dry chocolate, metal and roasted malts. Flavors of kahlua, acidic black coffee, dry roasted malts, aldohol and bitter ash. Yikes. Hot. Enormous. This one needs to sit for a bit.

On tap. Pours an opaque black with a large, creamy, long lasting, tan head that leaves plenty of lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, coffee, caramel, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, caramel, vanilla, licorice, light smoke and oak with a warming bourbon finish. Full body with a thick, creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very stout-like. Lots of complexity, awesome.

Bottle. Black, with a thick brown head. Sweetish aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and dark fruits. The flavour is roasted malty, with chocolate and coffee, notes of wood and vanilla, and a warm roasted finish. Tasty.

Draught at Lost Abbey/ Port Brewing Taproom San Marcos, 23.4.16. Black with a beige head. Vanilla, coconut, a little ink and cocoa nibs in the nose, bitter, ink, medicinal/ alcoholic in the mouth, but the alcohol becomes subtle in the second sip. Full body, a little fizzy, iodine in the finish. Rich and good.
Pours motor oil black roasty aroma coffee, and maple taste. Great overall flavor

Bottle from Beergium. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, toffee, coffee, dark fruits, wood, oak and a bit of alcohol. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coffee, nuts, dark fruits, toffee and wood. Exquisite American strong ale.
This is a handful. Pours jet black with a tan head. Huge roasted aroma of chocolate and coffee. Full mouth feel, finishes with light notes of smoke.

65cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured pitch black with a two finger mocha tan head. Looks amazing in glass. Aroma: Dark espresso coffee, lots of vanilla, caramel, dark chocolate, dark fruit. Taste: Espresso coffee, dark chocolate, loads of vanilla, licorice, chocolate chip cookies, caramelized creme brulee, dates, plum, toffee, dark fruit, oak, whole wheat bread, currants. Medium carbonation. This is so thick, creamy & chewy it almost drinks like a milkshake, awesome! A full body with vanilla and dark espresso beans in the long finish. This beer is classed as an American Strong Ale. It looks and drinks like a stout but it kinda lacks the roastiness of a stout. Anyway this is an absolutely amazing brew!

0.65 bottle. A very dark brown color and a humungous, brown head. Aroma of cookies, this is the absolute epitome of cookishness and biscuitness complete with brown sugar, dough, waffle chocate, and a hint of almonds - a splendid fragrance reminiscent of a mixture of Quatro and Bafomet. Taste is sweet, malty, chocolaty, delicately smacking of alcohol. A full body, a creamy texture, and a flat carbonation. Finish is medium long, somewhat diluted, the shackles of alcohol seem to be straining towards the end. Overall not a bad beer; if only it continued the style of its top-of the-class aroma until the end.

Aroma: chocolate, brandy.
Taste: moderate to strong sweetness with light to moderate bitterness.
Flavour: burned and roasted, sweet robusta, chocolate liqeur, molasses.
Finish has alcohol, some hoppy bitternes.

Very good.
Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours brownish with reddish hue. Oak, caramel whiskey nose. Flavour followed nose. Sweet port with whiskey oak aftertaste.

Deep black brown, tan small head. Deep molasses, caramel, light anise. Some roastiness and vanila. Sweet, decent bitterness. Heavyish, upfront alcohol, very oily. Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22oz bottle. Black like used oil. Licorice, burnt wood, very dark roast. Completely unsweetened. Body is a bit thin and too carbonated for something that advertises itself akin to used motor oil.
Black pour, tan head, nice lacing. Roasty and slight smoked wood with chocolate and dark fruit on nose. Flavor follows nose amd finish dry and roasty. Medium soft body. Nice stuff.
Bottle served in a snifter. Black with a short lived brown head. Ashy, coffee, chocolate with a slight dryness. Quite thin and fizzy for the style but a solid IS. Not a patch on Serpents though.

On tap at Mohawk Bend in snifter. Aroma is strong roasted malts, dark fruits. Appearance opaque black with finger-width light brown head with fair retention and nice lacing. Taste is moderately sweet dark fruits with some chocolate and anise. Palate is heavy full bodied with thick texture, average carbonation, with nice long finish of dark fruits. Overall, this resembles an imperial stout. Great full-bodied winter beer.

A decent brew. Ive had this before. I dont think the deScription here is correct. I see nothing that links this to lost abbey nor is it classified as a double imperial stout on the bottle. Still a decent glass of beer, smooth and easy to drink. No booziness and not bitter.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 160219. Bottle (650 ml) from Mikkeller Bottle Shop. Roasted malty and woody, chocolate and coffee, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted.
Bottle from mikkeller beershop. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts, coffee, Wood and chocolate. Dry finish
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 19/2-16. Bottle from Mikkeller Bottle Shop. Roasted malty with chocolate and notes of coffee. Body is medium, the finish is dry and roasted.
Bottle @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a light tan head. Notes of brrrrrbn, sweet malts, booze, light caramel and some light soy.

Bottle. Pours black with nice tan 1 finger head. Aroma is kind of fruity, some yeast, roast and burnt caramel. Light booze. Also quite some chocolate as it warms. Tasty is roast and sweet. Packed with raisins and caramel. Light port notes. Full body with roasted finish, dominated by coffee notes. Slightly boring.

Wonderful aroma of coffee, liquorice and dark chocolate. Celestial good taste of the same as the aroma plus oak barrels. Good blend. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Delicious beer that you can enjoy for hours. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasty, tobacco, spicy, dark fruits, malty. Taste is about the same. Light fudgy and vanilla notes from the barrel, but mostly the base beer left. Some licorice in the back aswell. Older is sooo much better than this!

Bottle. Pours a reddish, Dark brown with a big, bubbly head. Aroma has roasty malts, chocolate malts, licorice, slight caramel and some vanilla. Taste is pretty malty, roasty bitter, slight vanilla, some spicy notes. Medium sweet. Medium savory. Pretty High carb and a medium full body. Good beer.. How is this not a stout?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thanks alex old bottle unknown vintage very dark thin head liquorice roadty coffee good dryness medium bitterness dark chocolate light woody

Smells surprisingly malty with notes of plum and prune. I am also getting oak, slight milk chocolate and booze. Pours a very dark brown color with reddish hues and more dark tan foam than I was expecting. Tastes slightly bitter, but in an oaky/boozy way, not a hop bitterness. There is a balancing bit of chocolate sweetness, but it is very slight. Very strong tasting and it definitely gets better as it warms. Underwhelming palate. I liked it, but older viscosity is better. Good, but not 100.

Pours dark color with mocco sticky head. Saturated malty, bready, espresso and and dark chocolate aroma, a little earthy. Coffee, roasty, chocolate flavors, a lot of bread. Really actually balanced. Full bodied, medium sweet and roasty bitter finish. Drinkable and really nice.

Old Ale leżakowane w dębowych beczkach.

Alkohol: 10 % obj.

Kolor: Czarny jak węgiel. Zero przejrzystości.

Piana: Beżowa, sycząca, średnio i grubopęcherzykowa.
Z prędkością światła i wielkim sykiem redukuje się do bezwzględnego zera. Nie pozostawia po sobie nawet milimetra kołnierzyka.
Minimalistyczne zacieki na TeKu.

Zapach: Rządzą tutaj słody.
Jest przypieczona skórka od chleba, toffi, karmel, miód, a także czekolada.
W oddali trochę ciemnych owoców.
Pojawia się również paloność i delikatna żywiczna nuta pochodząca od chmielu.

Smak: Zdecydowanie bardziej słodowy niż chmielowy.
Odnaleźć tutaj można całą fabrykę czekoladowych sztabek z wyraźną kawową nutą na finiszu.
Profil słodowy rysuję się: miodem, posmakiem tostowym, karmelem i toffi.
Uzupełnia go subtelna chmielowa, żywiczna nuta, która jest jednak tylko tłem dla słodów.
Goryczka jest średnia, dobrze wpleciona. Finisz jest bardzo trudny do określenia: balansuje między słodkim, a wytrawnym.
Drewniane niuanse dębowej beczki przeplatają się z lekką wanilią.
Alkohol cholernie zdradliwy. Pijesz to bez zupełnego wyczucia jego mocy, a kiedy wstajesz wtedy dopiero objawia Ci się jego ciężar.
Cudowna, lepka tekstura (nazwa piwa idelanie odnosi się do tego).
Jest tylko jedna mała rzecz która zaburza nieco doznania - jest to zbyt wysokie wysycenie.
Przez nie piwo chwilami staje się ciężkie.

Wysycenie : Wysokie.

Podsumowanie:
Styl American Strong Ale według opisu BJCP określany jest jako "malty-but-hoppy" czyli słodowy-ale-chmielowy.
Taka jest też charakterystyka tego piwa.
Zdecydowanie bardziej słodowe (karmel, tosty, skórka od chleba, palone słody, ciemne owoce, czekolada, przypieczona skórka od chleba), ale także z żywicznymi akcentami amerykańskich chmieli.
Styl nie jest tak bogaty i mocny jak American Barley Wine, ale jednocześnie nie jest tak mocno nachmielony jak Double IPA.
Balans ciągle przechodzi na stronę słodów.
"Stara Lepkość", bo tak można przetłumaczyć nazwę tego piwa jest trunkiem gęstym i lepkim, dlatego nazwa idealnie pasuje do klimatu.
Jedynym minusem tutaj jest zbyt wysokie nagazowanie, które sprawia, że momentalnie w połowie butelki stawałem się pełny i nie maam tutaj na myśli pełni z powodu nadmiaru słodyczy w piwie.
Piwo świetne, dostojne, ale wybitnie deserowe i degustacyjne.

Strong malty aroma of dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, bread, earthy hops.
Pours very black with creamy brown lasting head.
Chocolate in flavor with light coffee roasty notes, vanilla, bread. Well balanced. 
Medium full bodied with medium co2, lingering sweet roasty finish. 
Very drinkable. All the flavors blend in well and nothing is overbearing. Surprising for a high alcohol beer. Need to find a recipe for this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the Beards in SD. Thanks! Pours a deep black oil with a tan head. Big aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla, slight coffee, dark fruits, and roasted malts. Taste is the big dark chocolates up front with some coffee leading to the vanilla and caramel. Somewhat dry finish and not boozy. Nice balance. Medium to full body, decent carb. Flavorful.

Bottle. Very dark color, nice tan head. Sweet malty aroma, some roasty notes, dried fruits, caramel, coffee. Taste is sweet, light dry and bitter. Flavor of raisin, lots of raisins, chocolate, coffee, caramel, vanilla, oak. Full body, smooth texture and soft carbonation.

Kolor: bardzo ciemno rubinowy, klarowny.
Piana: obfita, szybko się dziurawi, miarę trwała.
Zapach: aromaty ciemnych owoców, lekko winne, delikatne akcenty ciemnych słodów, czekolady, kakao oraz wanilii.
Smak: niska pełnia, nuty ciemnych owoców z wyraźnymi akcentami ciemnych słodów, gorzkiej czekolady, kakao, goryczka w kierunku wysokiej, lekko palona, delikatne wyczuwalny alkohol.
Wysycenie: w kierunku wysokiego.

Süßlicher, deutlich malziger Antrunk. Intensive Holznoten, schokoladig, minimal alkoholisch. Weich malzig bleibend, geringe Herbe. Langer Nachhall, holzig, Noten von Vanille, trockener werdend. Sehr gut! 9/12/12/12/11/12

Draft pour at Bambinos. They poured me 16 Oz of this. Thanks! Forget about my beer order more often! Pours a near black with a tan swirl head. Sweet malts aroma. I remember having this a while ago, and my mental note from then was that this was super boozy. Not that way anymore. Times have changed I suppose. Very smooty, rich chocolate flavor, with a roasted finish. Simple drink for a double figure abv. Solid offer from these guys. Damn tasty.

Bottle. Pours almost black with tan head. In aroma roasted malt, some coffee and chocolate and quite lot of caramel followed by oaky notes.In flavour medium sweet, with chocolate notes, bit poor for imperial stout. Body is medium, oily in texture, softly carbonated. Finish is medium bitter and roasty. Good, but only good, I was expecting something more from imperial stout.

Notas a chocolate, café, maltas tostadas y madera, pero no tan intensas.

Color negro, carbonatacion alta, redonda, Corona de espuma abundante de alta retención.

Notas a café, chocolate, madera y maltas tostadas.

Cerveza compleja, pero a la vez fácil de tomar. 

En general una excelente cerveza, fácil de tomar. Pero a la vez compleja y deliciosa!
66cl bottle from 3er tiempo online store. Dark brown color. Thin beige head. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness. Aroma is malty, liquorice, chocolate, light roasted. Quite good.
Pours black, opaque. Huge dark tan head. Aroma is well-sugared coffee and some fruitcake. Velvety palette. Chocolate finish. Will probably develop a lot as it warms.

W aromacie zaskakująco niewiele się dzieje, ciut czekolady, ziemistość, po czasie się nasila, jest przyjemnie ale oczekiwania są wyższe. W smaku zbalansowane, czekolada, przypalony karmel, niezbyt pełne, lekkie kakao na finiszu. Piana szybko znika. Pijalne, dobrze ukryty alkohol. Świetne opinie, spora cena, a tak przeciętne piwo...
Black, small head. Aroma: smoked, nuts, raisin, vanilla, woody. Sweet, smoked on taste. Nice hidden alcohol. Lots happening.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber in LA. Rich, mildly sweet, malt and roast like an imperial stout but with big hop aroma too. Good beer, should rerate when more sober...

Bottle, 0.65l, shared with Tomaz. Pours almost black color with thick creamy light brown head and fair lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon, oak and vanilla. Taste starts with sweet and rich caramel malt with roasted undertones and chocolate, follows by licorice and dark fruits, mouthfeel is warming with well hidden alcohol, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, syrupy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Strong, smooth and just fantastic...
Great beer. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Taste is aggressive to start, but it has a long warming finish. Beautiful in the glass.
22 oz bottle Pours opaque, with a lasting tan head. Very Imperial Stout like in appearance. Aroma and flavor is very malty, chocolate, molasses, bourbon, smoke. Creamy smooth, and well hidden abv.
2/19/2009 7:56:39 AM Bottle in Northfield, MA. Black body with walnut head. Nose of malts, chocolate. Taste of malts, chocolate and dark fruits. Quite sweet and delectable. Nice one!

Bottle (from beergium). Pours black with brown head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is intense dark chocolate, roast, malt, some bourbon. Flavor is sweet, malt, licorice, roast, dark chocolate, smoke. Carbonation is rather high, alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.

Dark brown beer, medium to small tan head. Nose is leathery, roasty, tobacco, caramel, malt. Flavor is tons of roast and woody-malty-coffee- bitterness, ash, tobacco. Finishes with roast bitterness. Thick and substantial mouthfeel. About as elegant as a sledgehammer, but hey, this works.
Backlog. Dark brown, heavy on dried fruits, caramel. Sticky mouthfeel, some sweetness, long bitter finish.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a nice tan head, Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel, tobacco, ashes and oak. Flavour is light sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, semi oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, ashy, roasted and woody.

bottle at borefts afterpaty 15. poured a black colour with a tanned head. nose is filled with dark chocolate, burned caramel, red fruits. milk chocolate, and sticky syrup. molasses, medium bodied mouthfeel.
Dark brown with a beige head, moderate carbonation and coffee aroma. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, even anise notes to the complex flavor. Nice long malty finish.

Maybe a little on the heavy-handed side, but this damn thing is a huge malt monster. Carmel, roast, lactose, and a little of anise in there I believe. Just dont mess around with this one! Delicious. 22oz bottle.

Bottle bought in 2011. 
Aroma: Rich chocolate, hint of molasses, and graham cracker-like aroma.
Palate: Oh, so smooth!
Flavor: Chocolate, graham cracker-like flavors, touch of molasses, cinnamon note. Finishes with dark semi-bitter chocolate, subtle molasses and wood notes.
Comment: Superb and glad I aged it.

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Karl Strauss 26th anniversary snifter glass
From: Barons Market in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $6.99
Purchased: Aug. 28, 2015
Consumed: Aug. 28, 2015
Misc.: Bottled on March 25, 2015

Poured a black color with six fingers of frothy, tan head. Not usual for Port as it wasnt a gusher. Very good semi-layered foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Very good retention. (Sight - 4.13)

Smelled dark chocolate, dark fruits, light tobacco, toasty nuts, toffee, caramel, dark cocoa nibs, chocolate syrup, hazelnut, some coffee and dark plum. (Smell - 3.88)

Taste followed the nose somewhat, but felt a bit more like a Russian Imperial Stout. Got thick dark chocolate, coffee, roasty malts, toasty nuts, toffee, caramel, toasty oak, chocolate candy and hazelnut. Alcohol was well hidden. (Taste - 3.88)

Full body. Creamy-to-sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. (Feel - 4.00)

Slightly disappointed in this one, but Id probably have it again. Great value for $6.99.

3.90 88 B+

Oh yes, yes yes. This is the stuff wot I love. Dark, inky black pour with a darkish tan head. Sweet choco-coffee-toasted malty goodness with a particularly sharp finish that tastes of wood and a touch of burnt. But not too much, even though this is thick, dark, over the top in every other way. My favorite style and will drink this again and again.
650ml bottle. Black color with Beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, dark fruits, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full oily body with soft carbonation.

BOTTLE 22 OZ. Almost black with clear red highlights. Smooth aroma of coffee, some sweetness and aged spirits, a hint of fresh fruit and just a touch of booze. Something nice and oily like home-made cookies. The taste is intense, mellow roasted malts, moderate molasses and caramel, light hops bitterness that melts into the roastiness. Warming alcohol. All, in a nice rich yet drinkable and velvety smooth body. A touch of ashes in the finish. Excellent!

Almost pitch black in color with a brown or dark beige head. Aroma is huge with chocolate and fruits, mostly dark plums, raisins but also apple and cherry. The beer is oily and creamy as intended by the brewer. Lots of chocolate cake, toffee and dried fruits. Some clove and wood in the finish. Its a huge beer that is somewhere between a RIS, Belgian quad and old English ale. Good stuff.

Really dark beer, beige head on top. Really nice lacing sticks to the glass. Aroma has dark chocolate, caramel. Taste is quite fresh for a beer this volume. Dark chocolate, milk chocolate, caramel sweetness, syrup, some herbs. Medium body and medium carbonation. I expected a bit more oily body from the Old Viscosity but still this was enjoyable.
Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown color with a tiny light brown head. Thick roasty malt character with dark fruits, caramel, molasses, toffee. Thick, chewy. Very nice.

Pours deep dark brown with thick brown head. Nose is prune and oak. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, prune, dry fruits, caramel, oak notes. Thick texture, low carbonation. Very nice and powerful beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle. Black color with a tan head. Toffee chocolate sweet aroma. Heavy body. Chocolate espresso bitter flavor. Smooth but high octane.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

July 25, 2015 - 2011 bottle from Binnys. Black pour with large head and some sediment. Aroma was dark fruit, malt and oak. Taste was fruity and sweet with the oak coming in late. The finish was very dry and a little too much bitterness for me.

Pours a creamy, tan head on a dark mahogany body with red highlights. Peaty, licorice aroma that yields vanilla undertones as it warms. Robust taste of raw earth, mildly bitter dark chocolate and coffee grounds. Wood and roasted nuts are noticeable with a sharp black pepper finish. Very nice overall.
Amazing black brown color and vanilla aromas with a chocolate and coffee flavor. Amazing and I must have another right now!!

Bottle to tulip...thank Ferris
Chocolate, nutmeg, and a touch of vanilla. Dark brown with a thin light head. Chocolate, nutmeg and whatever.
Bottle - Raisins and some caramel notes. Deep brown with a nice brown head. Sweet, dark sugary malts and bitter notes. Lots of wood and bitterness.
Bottle, 650 ml at Svijet Piva, shared with Marko and others. Pours dark brown, brownish head. Roasted malts, licorice, bit of alcohol, fruity, chocolate. Sweet. Medium to full bodied.

On tap at the brewery. Black color with fine beige head. Aroma is dark malts, bready. Taste is malty, sweet, perfectly balanced. Viscous motor oil mouthfeel. Amazing, such a dark beer without these aggressive coffee flavors. A real winner!

(650ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, June 4 2015) Pours somewhere between mahogany and black with a decent sized head of dark tan foam that lingered with some lace. Aroma is has a lot of roasted malts with a slight ash tone, toffee, semisweet chocolate, fairly subtle dark fruit, a bit woody/earthy, light herbal hop overtone. Flavour has toffee and molasses core matched by fairly hard roasts, with coffee and cacao bean, burnt wood, touch of tobacco and dark fruit. Towards the finish, dries a lot, wood and earth, roast, pine, cacao, a bit of toffee lingering. Long dry aftertaste is moderately bitter and roasty. Full bodied with soft carb. Very impressive, the wood and roast makes this much drier than I was expecting, pretty complex but not cloyingly fruity. A really good American strong for not going over to the hoppy side. Great sipper.
Bomber at GGW 2015. Deep mahogany with a gigantic, dark head. Brown sugar, molasses, and caramel. Sweet and thick.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Aromat: potężne uderzenie czekolady, kakao, kawy, w tle paloność i leśne owoce pod postacią jeżyn, borówek. Nuta alkoholowa delikatnie obecna, do tego czuć aromaty beczkowe, drewno, skórę i odrobinę wanilii.
Wygląd: czerń z przepiękną beżową pianą, świetny lacing
Smak: początkowe uderzenie sosu czekoladowego, pralin i kawy szybko ustępuje zdecydowanie owocowym nutom. Prym wiodą jeżyny i borówki, w tle nuta cherry. Piwo ewoluuje z każdym łykiem, przewijają się nuty drewniane, palone, waniliowe, lekko kwaskowate (mniemam, że od palonych słodów). Finisz to dość wysoka, wspaniała, lekko ziołowa goryczka i delikatnie grzejąca, szlachetna nuta alkoholowa. Całość jest dość wytrawna, bardzo pijalna, aż chce się brać kolejne łyki, zapał dość szybko studzi dość wysoki procent alkoholu. 
Może galopuję z oceną, ale to jest jedno z najlepszych Piw jakie dane mi było degustować, zdecydowanie warte każdej wydanej złotówki.

It feels like a bit of a waste to have such an amazing brew as the last beer on a long-ish beer tasting evening. Still, an extraordinary beer like this one will always manage to show off regardless of any palate fatigue. It pours a pitch black body with a light-brown head that laces the glass well, and that ends up as a thin layer. The aroma is very strong and has some incredible notes of chocolate, chocolate sauce, coffee and a myriad of other roasted notes. The very strong flavour follows the aroma, with additional notes of dark caramel and vanilla. The taste is moderate sweet and the long-lasting finish is pretty heavy bitter. The mouthfeel is amazing, it actually is as viscous and full-bodied as the name indicates. Its creamy and smooth on the palate and with a moderate carbonation. Brilliant! 
[65 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Vika]
Opaque Bkack with tan head. Fennel in aroma was pleasant. Very thick as name implies. Coffe and roasted nuts in flavor with the fennel popping through.

Draft at the brewery. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy, bubbly tan head. Tastes like sweet dried fruits, booze, ash, earthy malts, woody. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like dried dark fruits, earthy, woody, light ash.

Espresso, smoke and big roasted malt notes dominate the nose. The mouth is very big with candy sugar, espresso, cherries and a massive amount of hop bitterness. Warming alcohol finish with long lingering roasted malt notes.

Thanks Iznogud, Vanja & others for sharing! Impressive black body with a brown-tan head. Sweet, full aroma, coffee, malts, slightly candyish, slightly sticky, with a fresh note, perhaps vaguely herbal permeating it, though I couldnt pinpoint what it actually was - the aroma actually avoided the overbearing feeling some beers of this style/strength have because of it. Taste... lovely fresh coffee vs. some herbal/fruity, slightly flowery perhaps note that seems like a continuations of that thing in the aroma, slightly milky/sweet near the end. Fantastic, just fantastic.

22oz bomber gently poured into my snifter glass yielded a tremendous amount of khaki/tan colored frothy foam. Not much in the way of lacing for this viscous black colored stout but the foam settles across the top. Getting some roast, caramel, molasses, and maybe a vanilla/bourbon scent. Old Viscosity is actually, for me, quite flavorful and complex. Getting some chocolate, coffee, toffee, vanilla, caramel, molasses, and roasted malts. I must say this is one of the most carbonated imperial stouts Ive ever encountered and the "fluff" from it is coating the palate quite wonderfully. Overall, I had high expectations for this Port Brewing offering and they did not disappoint!

Bottle. RB Meeting Vienna March Edition. Black body with brown head. Aroma is roasted malts with some chocolate.Taste is bitter with roasted malts sweetness. Aftertaste is bitter balanced by malt sweetness. Nice one.

22oz bottle pours dark brown black with 2 finger light tan head. Nose has some soft rounded whiskey oak, dark fruit, touch of cocoa, some pine. Taste is medium bodied, dark malt fruit with a touch of cocoa and soft roast, finishes with some bitter earthy pine, hoppier than expected, and bits of vanilla, touch of wood and chocolate.

650 ml bottle shared by Sebilinz at RB Tasting Vienna March Edition. Thanks!
Black body, with a big, creamy, brown head.
Aroma with lots of dried fruits, coffee, alcohol.
Tastes of roasty coffee, dried fruits, lots of sweet malts, some smoke, fruity hops.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, a bit smokey, with coffee, dried fruits, subtle hops.

Very nice. The nose isnt that special in my opinion, but the taste is enjoyably full malty, without forgetting about the hops. Overall not the best American Strong Ive had, but one I would gladly drink again.
Pure black color with a frothy brown lasting head. Liquorice, toasted malt, chocolate and caramel aromas. Flavor is very sweet with vanilla notes. Body is very dense and carbonation is low.

Botte. RB Tasting Vienna March Edition. Black body with low tean head. Aroma has pear notes, coffee, caramel, roasty with light alcohol touch. Taste has roasty sweetness, none to low earthy bitterness. Body is heavy, oily, medium soft carbonation.
Bottle. Aroma dark chocolate, cocoa, general roastiness. Pitch black colour, nice brown head. Taste is mostly roasted, balanced sweetness and roastiness. Ashy, burnt a bit. Very good.

Bottle kindly shared by Sebilinz, many thanks. Very dark brown color with thick beige head. Candies, roasted malt, dark chocolate in aroma. Candies, roasted malt, coffee in taste together with licorice, red fruits, alcohol. Good.

bottle shared by Sebilinz at RB Vienna March Tasting. black color, very dark nice coffee colored head. fruity smell, dried fruits, light sourish, light smoked, malty sweetness, liqueurish smell, a bit like glue (but not in a bad way), quite nice smell. very full body, quite bubbly, good carbonation, some smoky taste, lot of malty backbone, some malty sweetness, some roastiness, alcoholic. light dry / malty / roasty finish. quite good, overall a bit too malty.

Bottle at RateBeer Tasting Vienna March 2015 edition. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, coffee, alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, coffee, caramel, chocolate, roasted malt.
Testad på Linköping Beer Expo. Djupt brun nästan svart i färgen. Mörk beige färg på skummet. Kaffe och choklad toner i smaken.
Kaffee, Bitterschokolade, relativ viele dunkle Früchte in der Nase, Röstmalz. AM Gaumen sehr trocken, kaffeebitter, dunkle Früchte, Schokolade. Cremig. Etwas zu kaffeebitter.

Bottled 650ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Pitch black, medium sized brown head, chocolate in the nose. Heavy roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, dried fruits and alcohol with rather sweet finish. Dried fruits and roastiness in the aftertaste with back up alcohol. Couldnt find myself in this one.

Bottled @ Roosteri. Bottled 07/06/12. Almost black beer, dark beige head. Truly intense malt flavor, oily liquid bread, sweet dough, raw cocoa and loads of fragrant, light dried fruits and slightly acidic berries. Deep, deep maltiness, liquid bread, sticky and slightly acrid toast. Long aftertaste with cold coffee and loads of raw chocolate. Slightly oaky finish has aged sherry notes with firm, clean bitterness. Full body, velvety soft texture with woody dry finish.

1 pint bottle; jet black with brown head. Rusty, dark chocolate, coffee, a bit of wooden, also some ripe fruits and whisky aromas. Taste complex, light sweet and medium bitterness, very nice mouth feel, with long finish. A very good beer!

Dark and smokey with a hint of nuts. It has a really smokey taste on the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft @ The Blackbird, SMF. Roasty notes in aroma. Black color with reddish tint on edges, Little to no head. Very malty flavor, with roast, a little sweetness, touch of molasses. Doesnt taste as alcoholic as it is, very smooth. Full malty mouthfeel. Overall, a delicious Strong Ale!

Bottle. Not my first. I love the Older Viscosity with all my heart and this is almost as good. Big flavour with Chocolate, fag-ash, vanilla, stewed prunes and coffee all making an appearance. Bold and well balanced. Wonderful stuff.

Butelka 0,65 l. Czarna, nieprzejrzysta barwa, gęsta niczym zużyty olej silnikowy (patrz etykieta na butelce) konsystencją mocno przypomina RISy. Aromat ciemnych owoców, wanilii, kawy, czekolady. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.
Bottle @ Three Notchd Tasting. Strong caramel and toffee. Cofee. Earthy brown sugar. Taste is very rich, smooth and supple. Coffee creamer. Chocolate. Rich and smooth, nice. Soft.
Bomber dated 8/24/14 poured into a snifter..jet black with a fluffy 1 finger tan head..aroma of coffee,chocolate,roasted nuts..smoky, thick, malty,dry..really good.

Bottled date of 10.23.13.
Poured from a bomber into a tulip on 06.20.14.

A: 5 finger tan head that stays. Midnight black with no red in the glass.

S: Lots of chocolate. Also dark fruit, cherry, and cream. Its almost mousse-like.

T: Chocolate, mousse, and cream dominate. Cherry and a tiny bit of oak woodiness are subtle.

M: Creamy smooth.

O: Wow, this blew me away! I was not expecting such complexity and flavor. The cherry really comes on strong to mix with the chocolate and slight oak. The alcohol is hidden very well and nothing throws off the balance. This is a favorite for sure.

Negraa negraaa negraaa. Curioso olor más ácido de lo esperado. Cuidado que es de la que suben los coloretes en los mofletes de la cara. Sabor muy complejo, achocolatada, especiada. Mejor dejar que se vaya calentando. Gran cuerpo y muy equilibrada. Esto es para terminar y cerrar la noche con esto.

Bomber, 2014 vintage. Roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate, coffee, oak, and smoke. Pours deep black with 2 fingers of off white head with excellent retention and some lacing. Starts with rich chocolate, roasted malt and coffee flavors with a rich body and smooth mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with all the above flavors and well as a good amount of oak and smoke that lingers on the palate. Really, really good.

Pours like used filtered motor oil with big caramelized head and good lacing. Nice full mouthfeel, with good body an excellent stout with limited oak character, tons of flavor in this one. Roast, smoke, chocolate, espresso.

Bottle. Over a year old. Black, thin mocha head. Dark syrupy, roasty oak aroma. Smooth smokey taste. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours black with a nice brown head, aroma of smoke, coffee, wood, chocolate, brandy, flavor of chocolate, brandy, coffee, wood, medium to full bodied, Nice.
Black, brown head. Nose of dark malts, chocolate, coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate, roastiness, a bit smoked. A kind of imperial porter, difficult to drink an entire bottle, yes complex.

Bottle shared with friends from Saveur-Biere - Color: deep dark black liquid. High viscosity and no carbonation with small brown head. Smell: caramel, toffee notes, roasted malt, black bread and high coffee nose. High complexity on nose. Taste: nice sweet palate with good viscosity. Roasted malt domination with coffee and chocolate notes. High sweet sensation. Small alcohol taste. Explosive sensation! Aftertaste: nice coffee taste with malt balance. Really nice work! Amazing beer!

Clear dark brown body with a medium to large brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, some caramel, coffee, some dark fruit, some woody bourbon aroma too. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness. Long finish, full body. Nice strong ale. Really liked it.
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a little sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice, and alcohol - with a bitter finish.
Bue en bouteille. Une tuerie absolue ! Bière noir profond, complexité incroyable au palais. Boisé, grillé, les saveurs se mélangent. Pointe vanillé et café sur la finale. Wahou !

22 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Bottled 10/23/2013. Black with 2.5 fingers of frothy tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, caramel, subtle dark fruit, a bit of amaretto. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, some floral hops, caramel, some oats. Full body with a dry finish. Nice thick oily mouthfeel. Medium-low carbonation. Very nice even with a bit over a year on it, dont really get much barrel character if any so maybe thats faded.
22oz bottle pours a dark black color with a bit of beige head. Smooth maltiness with a bit of hop bitterness. Loads of bitter chocolate.

0,65 l bottle 
caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty, herbs, earthy, alcohol, woody, brown, hazy, rocky head, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle (22oz $6.50): Color black with two finger light brown head the disapeears leaving lacing. Did not get a lot of armonas. Taste is strong roasted chocolate and a little bit of coffee. Little sweetness. Seemed similar to an imperial stout.

Pours pitch black with a beautiful head. Aroma: chocolate, espresso, raisins, with a touch of alcohol. Taste: very well balance between the coffee (sourness) and chocolate (sweetness) with some alcohol (generally well hidden 10% ABV). The beer is pretty thick although I have expected more thickness from "motor oil" (as advertised on the cover). Generally this is a very good beer. Something between a strong ale and a russian imperial stout. I was expecting it to have more features of the latter and therefore was a bit disappointed. On the other hand that was not a wise expectation since there is not a single word on the cover mentioning it is a RIS.
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pourd dark brown with minimal head. Light oak smell with roastiness. Taste of bitter dry malts and hops. Okay beer.
This is a really great strong beer. Lots of strong toasted, roasty notes, a hint of hops bitterness, dry finish. Pours nice and dark with a thick head. Great beer.
Bottle pours dark reddish brown with foamy tan head. Roast, caramel, chocolate, wood, soy sauce. Moderate bitterness and sweetness. Medium smooth body. Trailing bitterness.

At a tasting, many thanks DSG, zvikar and Ariel,big bubbly light brown head, quite dense with lots of carbonation, almost completley opque black colour, aroma of milk chocolate and dark malt, with cocoa and a hint of roastiness, roasty flavour with some coffee, quite sour, needs a little more sweetness to balance, rquite easy to drink and just a little simple. Good and interesting but not too exciting..

Aroma: coffee and toasted malts. Appearance: black, beige, small head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light vanilla coming up, intense caramel, toasted malts. Overall: very interesting American Strong Ale, almost though this more an Imperial Stout. Pint at Lost Abbey/Port Brewing, San Marcos.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Soft roasty, oaky, light vinous, deep caramelly nose. Soft smooth body, well hidden abv. Herbs, coffee malty, cedary. Pretty nice, complex drink.-- bierbäshöör

650 ml bottle shared @ The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Pitch-black color with a big brown head. Aromas of coffe, dark chocolate, oak and dark berries. Bittersweet taste, with coffee, chocolate and oak up front, followed by burnt caramel, dark fruits, liquorice, some roasted notes and some alcohol. Very nice aftertaste, lingering. Full body with low to medium carbonation.

"thats a nice beer...must...get...older...viscosity. pours brown-black, very stoutish. all the aspects the brewer describes...cocoa, wood, vanilla, and ash are all there. complex, but not overhelming. smooth for 10%. the aroma is more stout than anything else, but the flavor defies categorization. very very good beer."

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Black, almost completely opaque, with a big tan head. Aroma of roast, wood, vanilla and a bit of cocoa. Bittersweetish flavor, roasty, with wood, coffee, vanilla, a bit of licorice notes and a light hoppy bitterness with a tart touch. Pretty full-bodied, well-carbonated. Very nice.

Californian provision ale with deep brownish beige, creamy, thin head and blackish colour with a wine-red hue which becomes visible only under bright light. Complex aroma of coffee, dry sherry, fondant, bitter chocolate, liquorice, whisky, pistachio nuts, vanilla, sweet paprika, banana, wood, orange peel. Candied fruits, banana and walnuts in the mouth, spicy notes (pepper, bayleaf), smooth and syrupy, thick mouthfeel, powdery too, finish complex with oaky tannins, assertive American citrussy hops, some cloying sweetness an warming, bourbon-like alcohol. Very rich and tasteful beer, somewhere between an old ale and an imperial porter.
Kinda more of a imp stout, but not as roasty, but not as hoppy or red like a Double Bastard. Great brew but doesnt seem to fit in this go around. Really thick hence the name. Really good too.

Pours black/very dark brown with a large tan head.
Nose shows cocoa, toasty malt, figs and nutty malt.
Flavours include more roast, sweet burnt toast, some pine and resin.
Too highly carbonated.

Bue en bouteille de 37.5, couleur noire pétrole, pas de mousse ni deffervescence, nez complexe sur le côté bois de chêne et la vanille, en bouche cest ultra puissant, ça commence avec le café, puis le café au lait et ensuite gros côté grillé très noir

750 mL bottle. Im assuming that this is mis-labelled here. Its not an ASA. Or a barleywine, which is what the name led me to believe. Way too much dark/chocolate/black/roasted malt flavour. If I had to label it Id say its a double black IPA. And a darn good one.
Bottle. Dark fruit aroma. Taste is roasty with dark fruit and vanilla. Viscous body. Very good.
On tap at Flavor in Half Moon Bay, CA. Pours a rich brown / black. Aroma is licorice, espresso. Taste is licorice, espresso, dry roasted malts with a clean dry finish. Will try again.
Bottle. Black colour and beige head. Aroma and taste of hard roasted malts, espresso, liquirice and a bit dark chocolate. Very silky smooth, warm and well balanced. This one is superb!
Beautiful pitch bleach thick looking brew with a nice froth latte head on top. Milk chocolate bitter coffee bean nose. Silky thick , slightly bitter with a long slight numbing taste.
Looks like motor oil. Huge spongy head. Licorice sweetness with an espresso end. Massive beer. Leaves a very bitter roasted taste that lingers forever. Nice.

65cl bottle. Pours black with a big, creamy, beige head. Aroma is heavy sweet with strong notes of chocolate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with strong notes of chocolate. Thick body. Ends slighty roasted.

Bottle shared thanks to Tim and Rachel at Proof happy hour! Pours a deep black with hints of purple red, bubbly tan head that leaves light lace. Aroma and taste of vanilla, molasses, roast, slight bakers chocolate. Well hidden booze, but still some warming on the way down, nicely done.

Illatában pirított magvak, lágyan pörkölt kávészemek, kesudió, mandula, mogyoró gömbölyű aromái jelentkeznek elsőként, melyhez egy égetett fás, kissé fanyar karakter csatlakozik. Éjfekete színű testére egy kakaószínű hab telepszik, mely egy testes, közepesen szénsavas és igencsak száraz jelleget takar. Kávés, fás, karcos jegyek simulnak össze krémesen, majd hamuszerűen kesernyés, karcos komponensek vadítják meg az összképet. Fázós esték melengető italaként képzelném el leginkább, mely a porterek, stoutok, old ale-ek szerelmeseit egyszerre elégíti ki bámulatos sokszínűsége által.
Drack older i USA, CA. Old på hamnmästaren, fyllig kropp och smak. Mycket humle.

bottle shared with mowbeer and skykob, picked up at pivni rozmanitost in prague - on sale due to being 2 years old, not that we were complaining. almost black with a purple tinge and minimal beige head; aroma of choc-coated caramel; hints of tobacco, ash, vanilla cream; some alcohol showing but warming and pleasant. good stuff
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is vanilla, toffee, chocolate, taste is more of the same, quite sweet.
Bomber from MSM. Pours black thick tan head. Scent is a roasty chocolate one. Taste is dark chocolate, alcohol and cherries. Roasty flavor hangs around a bit. Good beer.

Jet black color with beige medium-lasting head. Dark chocolate on the aroma, roasted malts and ripe fruits are also present. Style is similar than an imperial Stout. Medium bodied. taste is full of roasted malts, chocolate and toffeee. Aftertaste has a persistent bitterness, full of coffee and chocolate. Well balanced.

Opaque black; no light gets through, two-finger, dense, coffee colored head and nice lace. Aroma of dark chocolate, pound cake, oatmeal, roasted grains, and dark fruit. Similarly complex flavor profile that includes chocolate cake, molasses, chocolate chip cookie dough, brownies, coffee and toffee. Gentle hop bitterness and a slightly warming alcohol presence also play a part. Full body, minimal carbonation, silky smooth mouthfeel, and a wll balanced finish.

Pours black with a fairly large frothy tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, muscovado sugar, honey. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, honey, vanilla, dárk red berries. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamybwith medium carbonation.

On tap at the brewery in San Marcos.

Pours black with a beige head that soon reduces to a ring but leaves a little lacing. 

Aroma: enticing aroma with a good malt base; hints of white wine. 

Flavor: rich but not particularly complex dark malts. No burnt elements. 

Feel: medium-full body; medium carbonation.

O: recommended

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 A colablack beer with a big, light brown and slightly soapy head. The nose is strongly roasted, black coffee, milky sourness and liquirice, vanilla, hint of chocolate and dark fruits. Nice aroma.´Taste has liquirice, coffee, quite strong bitterness, nice roastiness, vanilla, the end is herbal. Medium bodied, easy to drink. The strong flavours, still easy to enjoy. Good beer.

Black, brown head.
Chocolate roast aroma.
Brilliantly well balanced.
Really nice chocolate, coffee. 
Fine sparkly sweetness. Super pleasant. Nice spicy drink.

650mL bottle Bottled 10/23/13
Pours a deep, near-opaque ruby body. A small whispy tan head hangs around.
Nose is rich, complex; burnt caramel, dates, roast nuts, cocoa, charred oak, whiskey undertones, dried fruits, spice.
Carbonation is low, substantial weight on the palate without being overly heavy or cloying. Lingers long, warming.
Body opens out with rich dark malty goodness; notes of cocoa, nuts, dark crystal malt toffee, with dark fruits, raisins, figs & sticky date pudding. Finishes surprisingly dry, savoury, high bitterness but smooth overall.
Really good stuff; not over the top, as many of these American Strong ales can be.
Nice aroma of roasted malts, coffee. Tastes of roasted malts, bit dry with dried fruits. Nice body with a bite of alcohol and a dry aftertaste.

Bomber bottle shared. Pours black with a half finger, beige head that laces. Aroma has big notes of caramel, faint roasted malts, and subtle barrel flavours. Taste is on the sweet side with some nice roasted malts, mild alcohol and barrel notes, and a drawn out, espresso bitterness. Very slight booze as well. Full body with a medium carbonation. Creamy in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall awesome. Perfect for a cool night. Smooth roasted notes with an espresso bitterness at the end.

Barwa: ciemno brązowa, praktycznie nie przejrzysta. Piana jasno brązowa, początkowo grubo, następnie średnio i drobno pęcherzykowa. Dość obfita i ładnie oblepiająca szkło. Całość jest gęsta i oleista. 

Aromat: melanoidyny, orzech, karmel, ciemne i palone słody, suszone śliwki. Może niewielkie nuty "drewniane". Alkohol dobrze zamaskowany. 

Smak: pełny, słodowy, ale umiarkowanie słodki.Gorzka czekolada, spieczone ciasto, lekka kwaskowość. Wytrawny, palony i alkoholowy (nieco rozgrzewający) finisz. 

Tym razem ciemne mocne piwo leżakowane w dębowych beczkach. Spodziewałem się zatem wanilii czy taniny, niestety aromatów typowych dla piw leżakowanych w ten sposób jest bardzo niewiele, natomiast w smaku nie ma ich praktycznie wcale. Jest to konkretne i mocne piwo, co zdecydowanie czuć przy każdym łyku. Dla mnie początkowo było nieco zbyt wytrawne, jednak pod koniec przestało mi to przeszkadzać. Mimo tego spodziewałem się więcej.
Nice aroma of roasted malts, coffee. Tastes of roasted malts, bit dry with dried fruits. Nice body with a bite of alcohol and a dry aftertaste.

Pour from a small growler purchased last night at the Beer Authority, 2013 vintage. If I was smarter about this Id have picked up a bottle of older viscosity to drink at midnight for my birthday. Oh well, Ill find something else thats suitable. Anyway, pours dark, opaque with mocha head; decent retention, spotty lacing. Aroma brings chocolate covered hazelnuts, graham crackers and plums with a little bit of copper before it warms. Milk and cookies. Taste: moderately sweet milk chocolate to start, followed by a rich, roasty bitter finish. Oily, slick texture with medium body and appropriate carbonation. Some alcohol warmth in the end, but overall well-integrated. Overall: quite nice, and this $6 / 32 oz fill was too good a bargain to pass up. Despite being an American strong ale, this is basically an imperial stout in my book.

Bottle, unknown vintage. Pours an oily black with a thin beige head. Aroma is bourbon upfront, with roasted malt, bitter chocolate, a slight booziness. Flavor is massive, with emphasis on malt and bourbon. Alcohol is well hidden. Awesome. From notes 2/15/10.
Dark brown / black with medium yellow cap. Rich taste with smoked chockolade notes.

My first Port Brewing beer and what a way to start. Plenty of layers - cola, coffee, alcohol warm, aniseed, rich chocolate. The 10% is not particularly noticeable, partly due to the fizz keeping the palate light(ish). ($8 650ml, Best Damn Beer Store San Diego).
22 oz bottle poured dark and thick with lots of head. Aroma of roasty and sweet malts. Taste is awesome! Coffee, oak, vanilla, bourbon flavors dominate. Great smooth finish for being 10%.

Dark black in color... Aroma of dark chocolate malts... Flavor is licorice, dark chocolate, roasted malts... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a fairly thick dark brown color with a large tan head on there. Nose is dangerously close to a stout; I get a fair amount of roasting in here with a tad bit of caramel to sweeten it up. Taste is somewhat thick, with a very light roasting to it that makes it a really easy drink thats slightly bitter and extremely palatable. Really pleasant.

A special experience. Pours literally like used motor oil. Mouth feel is like wet silk, flavor.....well there's so much going on here it's hard to put into words. A unique beer to say the least.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A complex aroma of wood, bourbon, vanilla, caramel and oak. The taste is similar. Very balanced. Maybe a little to balanced and boring?
Bottle from De Hopduvel, vintage 2011. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Aroma of caramel and roasted malts. Some hints of coffee. Bitter hoppy finish. Decent beer.

Bomber. Clear dark reddish brown with a foamy brown head that lasts and laces. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, oak, dark fruit, plum and raisin and light vanilla notes. Flavor is the same. Full bodied, smooth with a slightly dry and bitter finish. Lingering roasted malt.

2 yr old bottle, 1/24/12. Pours dark with a reddish hue. There is an appealing sticky and defined tan brown head. The aroma is of semi sweet malts, soft smoke, hints of chocolate, and a nice bitter coffee like scent. In tasting I picked on a medium roasted malt flavor with bitter and sweet notes. It is sweet like carmel and bitter like an espresso. The finish is bitter, malty, semi sweet, with a very soft dryness, and had an almost acidic like taste. Overall a very interesting brew. It seemed to be a cross between a sweet porter and a roasty bitter stout. I?d have this one again and age was very kind to my bottle.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Karamell, fruchtig, hopfig. Geschmack röstmalzig, fruchtig hopfig, Karamell, leicht alkoholisch.

Pours totally black with a frothy brown head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, caramel, chocolate, woody notes with hints of bourbon. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a roasty and woody finish. Awesome.

Aroma: light hints of chocolate, oily coffee and alcohol

Appearance: black, frothy luxurious head, fine and rich tan foam

Taste: medium sweetness up front, giving way to a medium bitterness, lightly sour on the finish

Palate: medium body, creamy, slick mouth feel, softly carbonated, long and bitter finish

Not too thick, comes on like a stout without the glut. Shares features with a barleywine. Dark, dark pour from draft, three fingers of foam, and you taste the booze. I like that. Notes of cocoa on the nose with a background of bitter coffee. Tastes of chocolate and hop bitter finish.

Dark brown pour with quarter inch carmel brown head, looks a lot like cola. Smells along the lines of a porter or strong brown ale - Strong root beer/cola syrup, sasparilla, and licorice aroma, some chocolate as well. Foamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation, pretty clean finish. Flavor similar to an imperial porter. Robust roasted malts, piney hops, taste of dark bitter espresso, boozy woody oak, some molasses as well.
Botella de 65cl tomada en El Cabanon y El Lúpulo (Asturies). Maravillosa cerveza con un sabor espectacular.
Fantastisk. Sort og tyk som beg. Smager himmelsk. Dejlig bitter. Må ikke være for kold. Den styrker på en kold dag.

Bottle. Pours brownish black with nice dense head. Aroma is caramel, smoke, charcoal, caramel. Taste is similar with some good spicy notes. Little soy sauce sneaking in. Some raisin. Good clean finish.

Very glad this is easily available in Chicago now. A silky, sensous work of art. Begins with creamy chocolate ice cream, then fades into nutmeg, toffee, cinnamon, and light espresso, then finishes with expressive pine hop bite. Not even a hint of booze (but you start to feel it pretty soon...) Its obviously not trying to be a mind blowing imperial stout, but that is where I have set the bar for getting a 5, so this only gets a 4.8. If you are into big dark hoppy beer, im sure you have already tried this, if you havent...well all i can say is you need to get on this pronto...

Drank to at Lord Hobo in Boston and it was awesome. Unfortunately i was enjoying myself more than those with me and was forced to drink the 22oz bomber at a very fast speed leading me to the conclusion that this beer is not only delicious but extremely effective.

65cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo.01-03-2014.
In short: a viscous tasty dark ale.
Pours black with frothy creamy quite tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Roasty, spicy, wood, coffee aromas. MEdium body, viscous tecture, soft carbonation. Taste is roasty, coffee, spicy, raisins, some hints of wood. Quite long aftertaste. Smooth and very well balanced. Really enjoyable.

Pitch black with a tan head offering lovely coherent lacings. Noses of sweet/bitter chocolate, lightly of red wine, butterscotch, vanilla, raisin and woody. Heavy sweet, excellently balanced and very pleasant developing on the palate. Full bodied with a creamy-oily texture developing further aromas of whisky. Long lasting solidly ace finish.

On tap poured into a 4oz english tulip sampler glass. The aroma of sweet candy sugar sticks out with a hint of alcohol - kind of a gumdrop and / or gingerbread type smell. A thin espresso colored head tops the dark, opaque black beer and it leaves a light lacing down the glass. Its highly sweet with a faint bitterness. The palate is dominated by a heavy chocolate malt flavor from nearly start to finish. Its a full bodied, thick beer, but has a fizzy carbonation that gives it a slick quality. Theres also some burnt toast flavors on the tongue with some maple syrup, or molasses - in fact pancakes started to come to mind after awhile.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 Very thick and strong beer. Full taste of roasted malt, with cream, roasted bread, chocolate and molasses. Fantastic beer.
Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a darker tan head. Aroma is a little smokey, roasty malt, some booze, dark fruits. Flavor is sweet, smokey, roast malts, toffee, molasses. Very nice.

2011 bottle share thanks to scotchzi! Pours dark black with thin head and little lacing. Smell is amazing bourbon, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, booze, vanilla. Taste is bourbon, sweet chocolate, coffee, vanilla, booze, light tobacco. Thick oily mouthfeel. Would love to see what additional years does to this bottle.

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pours trick, deep black with flat brownish head. Smell has lots of coffee and roasted malts. Starts massively malty, with strong coffee notes, burnt malts and some alcohol. Goes into a coffeeish finish with lots of burnt toffee and some sweet chocolate.

Scored this shit from a bevmo in Sacramento. Shared it at super bowl party. I drive from Oregon to California just for this. Its thick. But flavorful. Not too much. Kicks your ass in all the right ways.

Really really good and could be confused as an imperial stout. Roasted malt aroma with a floral hop character. Pitch black and thick-looking. Nice tan head even though this is over two years old. Heavy and smooth palate with good carbonation. Strong on all fronts and I prefer it over the Older version. Strong hops bitterness up front followed my strong toasted and malt flavors. Also a woody influence. Truly great.
Drank with Thijs, Mark, Andy & Marjolijn 31-1-2014. Nice smell. Taste is good as well. A bit roasty. Balanced sweetness. Alcohol is very present. Bitter aftertaste. Good beer.

Bottle. Thick dark khaki tan head, mahogany rich dark brown nearing on black. Dark bitter chocolate, so me slight booze, earthy hops, and a roasts finish in the aroma. Flavor is very lush chocolate, roasted coffee, slight dark fruit, roasty coffee finish. Hefty body, with vibrant carbonation.
2011 bottle, shocking i have not had this yet. fuller bodied black pour. heavy roast, dark chocolate, rich, coffee, vanilla. Really good
Nice aroma of roasted malts, coffee. Tastes of roasted malts, bit dry with dried fruits. Nice body with a bite of alcohol and a dry aftertaste.

Fra flaske Cardinaltreff aug-13: elegant og lett i smaken (for sin høye omrdreiningshastighet) og med en ettersmak som varer og varer. Rund og fin, dette er balansekunst. Viskøs karakter, et deilig dessertøl.
330ml bottle. Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays.Malty, coffee, chocolate in aroma. Chocolate, coffee beans, sweet taste. Nice one.

Poured near black with amber highlights and a light brown head. Aroma of dark brown sugars, oak, and grains. Good bit of herbal-like hop notes, some malts, oak, sweet tones, and even earthy, vegetable-like qualities hinting towards bitter salad leaves. Finished dry and malty. Not my favorite style. I could not finish it as it made me slightly nauseated. Ten ounces might be good but a bomber is too much for me.
Sweet chocolate smells. Pours thick brown/black with an active tan head. Strongly bitter flavors, active carbonation and a long bitter aftertaste.
Dark and sweet with a sour aspect. Sips with a malty sweetness that I dont care for. Too much caramel and alc for an imperial stout. Would not get it again.
Bottle at the mayors house. Pours a dark black with medium tan head. Aroma is big coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is same, bitter finish perfectly balanced by roasty malts.

Appearance: Black dark brown, lots of dark tan head.
Aroma: Nice dark malt, roasted, coffee.
Taste: Very dark malt, coffee, roasted, warming, very nice. No alcohol taste.
Info: 650ml bottle, 26/12-2013
12/28/2013. 22 oz. bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Huge chocolate aromas with dark malt, coffee, dark fruit and hops. Thick and rich. Long lasting finish. Awesomeness in a bottle.
Bottle from BottleWorks, Seattle. Pours an opaque dark color, decent amount of tan head. Aroma roasty, smoky, chocolate. Body thick, rich and fruity, finish subtle and not so boozy. Pretty tasty.

22 oz. bomber. Pours deep, dark black with a huge, khaki/ light brown head. Leaves big, fat spiderweb lacing. Smells of charred bourbon oak barrel, alcohol, caramel, sweet grape(brandy), and astringent coffee. Very complex flavor, with evidence of nuts, roasted barley, coffee, and licorice. Not as heavy as one would think from such a thick, fat beer, but still quite substantial. Full bodied, thick texture, soft carb,. long bitter finish. The finish is a bit harsh, too bitter and boozy. Overall very nice, another strong offering from Pizza Port.

Bottle at Deans night before the night tasting, Den Haag. Poured a cloudy dark amber with a thin tan head. The aroma is creamy caramel roasted malt. The flavour is strong bitter with a boozy alcoholic liqourice palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared on the night before the night tasting thanks to Zer0. Pours near black with a light beige head. Aroma of malt, raisins, caramel, ripe dark fruits. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Dark brown with a white, thin, lacy, lasting, head. Smells of liquorish, vinous, yeast, malt, caramel, an yeast. Medium oily body. Tastes of dark malt, roast, chocolate, alcohol, and a bitter boozy finish. The end is a bit harsh.

Bottle at the night before the night tasting. Pours almost black with a brown head. Aroma is coffee, yeast, plums, malts, caramel and some red fruits. Taste is moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Zer0 @ the night before the night before tasting. 
Thick creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Very nice brew.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 22.12.2013, 0,65l bottle (bottled 6/7/12) @ home:
Big brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rich and sweet, dark malts, licorice, dark sugar, caramel, dark berries, coffee, chocolate. Taste is very balanced, dark malts, raw licorice, coffee, burnt caramel, hay, oak. Longlasting nice bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice one!

Bottle date: unk.

A: Pours a black beer with two fingers of latte head. This falls slowly to a thick quilt of the same. Cobweb lacing. Clarity is irrelevant. 

S: Smells like oak, dark chocolates, prunes, molasses, alcohol, hints of licorice. Beyond the alcohol, which seems a bit strong, the beer smells quite sweet. 

T: Refer to the smell for the taste, then add some graham and rye bread flavors. The alcohol isnt as offensive as I had prepared myself for, instead, the malts become spicy in nature and complement the addition of the oak. I gotta say, as it warms the beer seems like it becomes hollow in the middle, hard to describe, just has a dead spot.

M: Thick. Moderate carb. Sticky and chewy finish. Hardcore.

O: This is pretty good. I cant say I prefer it to some other oak aged stouts, but its nonetheless a nice beer.

Serving type: bottle

08-03-2011
Bottle from bevmo, san francisco. Black color, brown head. Aroma is roasty, coffee, some smoke, also little fruity. Taste is very smooth and balanced, roasty, coffee, licorice, hops. Excellent brew.

Surprisingly intense roasted maltiness for ASA, licorice, bit vanilla, choco. After my description, I would say its quite IMPy, but theres quite intense hop character as well.. so let it be ASA.
Sweetish with quite dry finish. Nothing very complex, but highly enjoyable brew

Bottle share at kernel thanks to Leighton for this gem. Aroma is salty, sweet liquorice and choc. Opaque black caramel pour with a light tan head. Flavour is balanced malty sweet chocolate, and light roast. Really good balanced big beer.
Dark, simple roasted malt, well balanced, solid head. Price performance could be better, but definable worth a try.

Simply a great Ale!! Smooth, dark and serious. Very smooth and not Boozy for 10%ABV. As a strong ale fan, I love this beer. Just sip and savor! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 65 cl en el lupulo. Un par de veces durante el verano de 2013. Alucinante cerveza. Cuerpo medio con increíble sabor amargo, tostados y quemados muy bien combinados. Muy recomendable repetir.

light beige head disappears without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma yeasty, bit spicy like saison, roasted malts. taste like aroma, bit coffee, slight bitter. rather thin mouthfeel, too much carbonation.  bottle 65 cl

22 ounce bottle. Thanks Dave! Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, caramel, and dark fruit. Excellent balance. Excellent American Strong Ale or whatever.

Bottle care of Paul Unwin at The Kernel. Very dark brown, tan head, opaque. Nose is brown sugar, dark chocolate, lactic, vanilla, alcohol, dark fruit. Taste is rich chocolate, alcohol, vanilla, oak wood, sweet and sugary, treacly.

bottle @ALEhouse, Riga 
Funny why this beer is in this category cause to mee it is typical stout or strong porter with roasted backbone and hoppy side effects. Pours opaque black with tan-brown thick top. On nose dominant roasted malts plus some herbal hops touch at the end. Taste is average+ bitter, almost no sweetness to me. Medium to full bodied, dry finish. Casual stout with well hidden degree of alcohol.

Bomber into tulip. Darkest brown; thick, poofy mocha head. Smells of dark chocolate, marzipan, leather, metal shavings, cherry and blackberry. Predominant dark ryebread and charred plum flavor hugely roasty, bitter black malt, plasticy phenols and solventlike alohol. A bit one-dimensional. Wheres the oak? Creamy, sugary palate. Espresso finish. Why isnt this called imperial stout? Totally off the mark for ASA. In pursuit of a super black, super alcohol beer, some quality was lost.

Bottle shared at The Kernel - this one Id had in the ol cellar for nigh on three years. Pours clear, dark brown with a frothy, beige head. The nose has rich bread, ripe dark fruits and soft vanilla. Medium to big sweet flavor with fruit cake, chocolate, dark fruits, bread. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with semi-dark malts, light chocolate, cake, dark berries, light dirt, vanilla, more heavy bread. Lovely, rich and well balanced. Delicious.

Bottle at Craftheads. Big night... Dark brown black, golden bubbly head. Aroma is oaty, smoke and spice, darkness, whiff of booze, black treacle. 
Taste is lovely. Treacle, chocolate, cocoa, bit of coffee, smoky, oats. Finish is dry and long. Lots of malt. Really nice. Smooth and dangerous, quite thick. When it warms, more bitter. Nice. Light sweetness.

Pours black with a large tan head. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and hop aroma. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, oak, hop and dark fruit flavors. Full body and low carbonation. Smooth and slightly sweet mouth feel with just a hint of alcohol. Roasted malt and chocolate finish.

22oz bottle at the Kernel, Paul tasting. Thanks to Leoghton for sharing this one. Roasted malt aroma with a slight hint of bourbon or brandy. Black in color with a tan head. Very full palate adds to the experience. Tangy and bitter roasted malt taste hits first followed by solid chocolate hints and roasted coffee flavors as well. Very good.

Appearance: near black, with a shirt, light tan head and oily legs.  Aroma: burnt coffee beans, bitter chocolate, port, and some raisin. Taste: bitter chocolate, herbal astringency, some cherry, espresso, hint of molasses and bourbon. Finish: finishes oily, with a cough-syrup like medicinal booze note vying with burnt coffee for dominance. Notes: Meh. Im not sure I see what all the fuss is about. Big and boozy, but not balanced, with the burny, oily, and medicinal notes most prominent.

Bottle. Terrific beer, unsurprisingly. Rich aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, mild hops. Taste is very smooth at first but slowly reveals a great bitter edge, with plenty of roasty flavours, coffee and hops.

The beer pours an inky black with a little beige lacy head. The nose is coffee, and roasted maltsThe pallet is coffee, cocoa powder, and roasted malts. Overall very balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: charred coffee and not much else. Appearance: motor oil (big surprise there, given the name) and a very thick khaki colored head. looks like the foam on top of a rootbeer float. Taste: Bitter, bitter coffee and burnt barley. Some semi-sweet bakers chocolate on the end and finishes with a nice and smooth brown-sugar sweetness BUT aftertaste is bitter barley again.. No barrel aged presence in this beer (except I suspect it is what smooths out the brown-sugar taste). Mildly disappointing. Palate: for a beer named after a motor oil, it sure is thin. Lively carb on the tongue. Finishes really dirty--leaving a bitter aftertaste of burnt coffee/barley.

Im guessing I got a bad bottle, because this beers reputation doesnt jive at all with my experience.

Rated on 5-30-2009 at Fort Wayne, IN Tasting (Bottle) When poured, this beer forms a small tan head that mostly diminished, opaque brown body, and spotty amounts of lacing. The Aroma is coffee, vanilla and lightly smokey. The Taste is smokey, roasty, lightly malty, hint of coffee, and has a dry finish. The Palate is tingly and this is a full bodied beer. Overall, this beer has a very, very nice flavor, worth trying and a beer I would drink again.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2014 Black, oily, dark, rich head. Aroma is dark malt. Taste is choc flavours with roastiness in tow. ABV very well hidden. As it warms, the raisin flavours rise up. Palate is oily. Overall, good big beer, but still lacks a certain something.

On bottle from Vinminopolet Sandefjord . Black color , brownish foam . Roasted aromas , coffee, licorice; medium high aroma intensity - high viscosity. Full body & complexity. Well balanced. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2013 Bottle on SBWF. Dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma has bourbon, raising, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, oak. Taste is light bitter chocolate, sweet dried fruits and sweet malt, a very nice alcohol warmth in the finish.
motor black oil in colour. Chocolate aromas, bitter chocolate to taste and espresso. Had this at a tasting. Welcome to australia.

Bomber, bottled 10/18/11; about two years old. Found this on the discount shelf at my local beer shop. Score! Aroma consists of coffee, chocolate, toast, raisins, licorice. The wood is there, but faint. Pours impenetrable motor oil black with a medium tan head with decent retention. Taste starts out sweet and roasty, finishing bitter. The oak comes through more in flavor than it did in the aroma. Carbonation is average--I was expecting something more like Older Viscosity, which I remember being near flat. The body is fairly thick, but its not the sludge texture Older had; its actually just kind of an average body for a beer of this caliber. It seems like an imperial stout to me, although the label is purposely vague on style definition. Good and tasty, but not as impressive as its bigger brother!
Bottle. Dark with a large bubbly head. Aims is chocolate, figs, and dried cherries. Taste is rooted caramel and dark malt with some tannins and a slight bitter finish. Decent amount of carbonation.

Bottled on 8/7/12. Drank on 10/3/13. Te aroma was great. Aroma was chocolate, figs, vanilla. Taste has a very carbonated-home brew type taste. Aftertaste is chocolate, but with a slits metallic flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, licorice, dark fruit, coffee, light ash and light pumpernickel. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with notes of dark chocolate, coffee, licorice and dark fruit. Some sweet alcohol. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 8/7/2012. Pours pitch black color with a nice 1-2 finger dense tan head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, light char, toast, dark bread, toffee, light raisin, and roasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt notes; with good strength.
